05-20-2004, 02:15 AM #1 Jeninvegas View Profile View Forum Posts View Blog Entries View Articles Registered User Join Date Feb 2002 Posts 977 can you melt small soap bars to make one big one? Here's the problem:
We always accumulate leftover soap bars (Zest) because DH says they are too small for his hand and slip. I want to melt all the small ones and make one big one. Is this possible and/or worth the trouble? TIA Reply With Quote 05-20-2004, 08:32 AM #2 KrisB View Profile View Forum Posts View Blog Entries View Articles Registered User Join Date Jun 2001 Location aka kjaki Posts 5,097 I don't think that you can melt them, but I have heard of people softening them with water and pressing them into a new bar shape. HTH Reply With Quote 05-20-2004, 07:06 PM #3 smsraven View Profile View Forum Posts View Blog Entries View Articles Registered User Join Date Dec 2003 Posts 46 You can also take the small bars and place them in a pump with water for hand soap. Reply With Quote 05-22-2004, 09:11 AM #4 flossie73 View Profile View Forum Posts View Blog Entries View Articles chat Join Date Jan 2002 Location MN Posts 5,789 Well, while learning to make soap, I have learned this-called rebatching:
You can shave/grate the soap bars and put them in an oven safe pan. Add a little water, though it never specifies how much or how much soap to do at a time, use your judgement. Then place in the oven on a somewhat low setting, maybe around 250? I haven't done it this way. But I have shredded my soap and added a little water and done it on the stove top. It doesn't make a totally smooth ball/bar of soap, but it works. Reply With Quote 05-22-2004, 10:34 PM #5 debdog42 View Profile View Forum Posts View Blog Entries View Articles chat Join Date Mar 2001 Location North Central Idaho Posts 4,854 If the soap is Neutrogena it melts really easy in the MW and then you can pour it into a bigger container. I've done it for years! I never could get it to work with any other brand. Reply With Quote 05-24-2004, 01:57 PM #6 earthgrrl View Profile View Forum Posts View Blog Entries View Articles Registered User Join Date Mar 2001 Location Arlington, VA Posts 424 As an alternative, you could do what I did and buy a mesh"soap saver"- it's a pouch made out of the same mesh they make poufs out of. I got mine at Target for a couple bucks, but if you want to see what they look like, see the link below (note, I found this site via google and have never bought anything here, so I can't vouch for them)
http://www.sonomaaromas.com/bth_access.html Reply With Quote 06-10-2004, 07:42 PM #7 soapdeli View Profile View Forum Posts View Blog Entries View Articles Join Date Mar 2003 Location VA Posts 107 Yes, you can do this. It is called rebatching or handmilling. Here are some tutorials. http://www.soapdelicatessen.com/soap...ns/handmilled/ Reply With Quote
